PropertyBag.Description: Entity objects can be persisted in the Metanga system. They support basic Create, Retrieve, Update, and Delete operations
PropertyBag.Name: Entity

Property.Description: This is an identifier generated by Metanga for any entity. Metanga provides the ability to reference the entity with this identifier.
Property.Name: EntityId

Property.Description: This is an identifier that can be provided by you to refer to a Metanga entity. It is normally generated by an application outside Metanga that owns this entity (like a CRM or Financial application). This identifier has to be unique for the entity type (e.g. 2 accounts cannot have the sam external Id). The ExternalId simplifies integrations by allowing you to refer to any entities in Metanga by using identifiers that already exist in your application.
Property.Name: ExternalId

Property.Description: Name of this entity. This is a collection of key-value pairs where the key indicates the language code, and the value contains the name in that language. Language codes in Metanga are based on IETF language tags. For example: "en-us", "ja-jp". Valid values can be found in Metanga, under Configuration -> Languages To Support (see the Culture Code column).
Property.Name: Name

Property.Description: Description of this entity. This is a collection of key-value pairs where the key indicates the language code, and the value contains the name in that language. Language codes in Metanga are based on IETF language tags. For example: "en-us", "ja-jp". Valid values can be found in Metanga, under Configuration -> Languages To Support (see the Culture Code column).
Property.Name: Description
